Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim. 
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the final part of medical science, for its perfection and completion at the end, and for its explanations and clarifications, it seems to me that I must present to you this treatise, which is a branch of manual operation, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because manual operation is neglected in our region and time, to the point that it greatly endangers medical science, and its practice is hindered; and nothing remains of it except a few brief descriptions in the books of the ancients, which are misunderstood by most people and lead them to error and hesitation while their minds are closed and their strength, skill, and art are extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is evident to me that I must revive it through the arrangement of this treatise according to a method of exposition, clarification, and abbreviation; also by adding drawings of cautery tools and other instruments required for the operation, as well as their explanations, which are necessary for its preparation.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no good surgeon is found nowadays with a hand in our region is that medical art requires long training and its practitioner must previously be skilled in the science of anatomy which includes knowledge of the use of body parts, their forms, the way they are joined or separated from each other; the location of bones, nerves, and ligaments as well as their number and exit points; those veins that pulse and those that remain still, and also their locations.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates says that it has a great name but a small effect, and especially in the treatment of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for those who are unaware of what we have discussed regarding anatomy, they may not be convinced and could fall into error, which has led to the deaths of many men, as I myself have witnessed such cases where some were learned in theory but lacked practical knowledge.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I once saw an inexperienced doctor accidentally cut into a woman's neck, severing some arteries and causing severe blood loss. Unfortunately, the woman died due to excessive bleeding.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I witnessed another case where a doctor was about to remove a large stone from a patient's bladder using part of the bladder itself. However, due to this procedure, the patient died three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I was called upon to extract such a stone myself, and due to the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew that death would be imminent.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	I observed another surgeon who received compensation from a duke in our land. This surgeon operated on an impoverished Black man with a fractured hip; however, due to the surgeon's ignorance, he removed the fracture directly over the wound, using powder and strong ligatures without allowing any air to reach the wound.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called upon him; I prepared to remove the ligature and he achieved tranquility thus reducing his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if corruption has already taken hold in the limb and cannot be halted, it will continue to spread throughout the member until the patient is at risk.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I saw another doctor who punctured a cancerous abscess; it was ulcerated after some days and its malignancy increased significantly to the detriment of his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for this is that the tumour is pure of melancholic humour; it must not be treated by burning with iron but rather as a limb which suffers and should therefore be amputated.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And thus, my sons, it is necessary for you to divide the operation into two parts; one part is associated with health and healing, while the other involves riskier procedures which require careful attention.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already written this in every part of this book where the operation is fraught with danger and fear; it is essential for you to keep this in mind and leave that one behind so that its pages do not lead the way to slanderous speech about you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Under the care of God take your tools with diligence and compassion for patients, who require ease and comfort in their suffering.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best path towards salvation and praise-worthy success by the grace of God, leaving behind terrible illnesses that are difficult to heal, put aside your tools which cause fear, so that hesitation in your faith and reputation does not escape you: for greater is what remains for your glory here on Earth and beyond with the saints.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	He already mentioned in some of his instructions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat an illness with evil methods, lest you become known as wicked doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins with the first chapter of the first part:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the feet, ordering the tools and instruments of cauterization, as well as what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The second part division:
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with dryness and perforation, cupping, sores, arrow extraction, and similar procedures, covering the types of instruments used in each.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division into three parts.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter covers restoration and dislocation, as well as the treatment of twists and similar injuries; it is a comprehensive chapter on dealing with conditions affecting the head to the feet, detailing the various tools required.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Regarding cauterization with fire or sharp instruments, as well as remembering to use mild medications during the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	This begins the treatise which covers the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I wish to discuss the quality of the iron used for cauterization and the documents associated with it, as well as in which circumstances cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the discourse on the quality of cauterization iron and its documentation is lengthy and detailed, subtle in its scientific precision, and hidden in secrecy; great scholars have debated it extensively, but they disagree, so I will only borrow a little from their discourses to avoid being too wordy.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg. E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say this based on the words of that person, who has already experienced and uncovered this many times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable for someone to come and treat this who has already been expelled and practiced in the chapter of cautery due to their past actions, and they have not understood the diversity of human composition and the arrangement of diseases within their bodies, as well as the causes of these illnesses, and the accidents that occur over time.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But for other compositions of the body, you should not be afraid or hesitant, especially in treating cold and humid illnesses, as all doctors have come to an agreement about these cases, and there is no disagreement regarding the use of cautery for their judgment.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Know, my child, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire and its goodness is based on the use of caustic medicine. This is because fire is simple in nature; its action only affects the part that is cauterized and does not harm any other nearby body parts except for causing a minor injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of caustic medicine affects the healthy parts around it and can cause difficult-to-heal illnesses in these areas, which is often hard to treat.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le cual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I state that the use of cautery is appropriate at all times, as it draws out any harmful substances caused by an accident and promotes healing. This is especially true for pains or necessary injuries such as bruises and fistulas, which cannot wait due to concerns about potential complications arising from delays.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not understood by your physicians; my dear children, they only consider the opinion of common people and foolish doctors. It's just that the illness which can be cured with cauterization doesn't always recur, but they fail to recognize this fact.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	The reason for their misunderstanding is not as they believe; cautery itself is a form of medicine that disturbs the body's balance and dries up moist humours which are the cause of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Moreover, cautery is still more efficacious than medicine due to the speed of its action and the majesty of God's power.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible for the illness to recur at some point in time depending on the patient's constitution, the location of their ailment, their personal character, and whatever unhealthy humours may have accumulated within them or been acquired through food and similar causes; unless it happens to be an acute illness involving few superfluities and moist humours (like toothache and its ilk), then cauterization should prevent a recurrence. But this only applies to minor cases of pain.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here, know that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention understood by the common people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancient masters said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they said this because of the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not make an arm weak, and while this is not entirely true, I have proven it myself and found that it only has this effect on some bodies and not others. And so cauterization with gold is good and better than iron as they say; however, when you use a golden cautery stick, it is important to remember that the amount of heat generated depends on the quantity of gold you use due to its conductive properties, and it must be prepared to receive the heat. If you expose the gold to an open flame, it will melt because of its low melting point, which can be problematic for the artisan.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And so, for this reason, we must perform iron-based cauterization with as much precision and care as possible to ensure the accuracy of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have already arranged this chapter on cauterization according to the chapters that follow it, and I've placed those related to foot operations at the end so that anyone who wants more information can easily find them.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization procedure introduces moisture and coldness into the brain, which is caused by two factors: one factor being a sudden shock, and the other being an excessive flow of rheumatic humor, known as 'corissa', affecting the head and extending to the limbs, ears, nose, causing excessive sleepiness, toothaches, and sore throat. It also applies universally to all illnesses stemming from coldness, including paralysis, heart conditions, apoplexy, and similar ailments.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: First, instruct the patient to take a laxative medicine that cleanses the head over three or four nights, depending on their health condition, age, and usual habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then, ask the patient to shave their head and have them sit between your two hands on a chair, with their arms resting upon their legs.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Next, place your palms over the patient's head, ensuring that the edges of your hands rest on their nose, in between their ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, once your hands have reached the center point of their head, mark that spot with a tent. Then prepare an olive-shaped cautery tool which takes this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the marked spot in such a way that it descends and with which your hand is gradually constricted, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently remove your hand and observe the place; if you see that any part of the bone is already exposed along with some amount of brain matter, then lift your hand, but return it to the same iron instrument, or another one from those mentioned before, which should be cooled as described previously. 
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take some salt and dissolve it over the affected area, leaving it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place on it some frosted quicksilver (mercury) and leave it there until the burn scar is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the wound with a salve made from four medicinal herbs until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it has been said that when the Roman plague appears, both arm (limb) and trunk are better treated with honey, as it is more beneficial and helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the ulcer should be cauterized right down to the bone, and let the cautery sit there until a part of the surface of the bone is destroyed.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is attached to the bone, and treat it accordingly.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others said that the use of cautery should be applied to the back, pressing firmly onto the bone until it penetrates, and this is the small form of the cauterizing tool.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that from that place (the back), vapours arise, which affect the brain.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	If the wound remains open for too long, it should be treated once it has healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauterization performed by others, only in a few cases due to fear; however, I believe that one should prioritize their health when it comes to such matters. For the brain becomes weakened through the loss of continuity and substance, as we have observed with other body parts, especially when the patient's head is of a delicate nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cauterization is safer, in my opinion, and I recommend it for the benefit of the patient's health.
Capitol segon.	It seems that your provided text does not contain this section or chapter. Would you like me to rewrite the provided medieval medical treatise? If so, please let me know!
Del cauteri del cap.	Del cauteri del cap.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the top of their head with a cautery while the bone is still exposed.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and expose as much of it as we measured previously, then cauterize that area with a cautery at the back of their head in a place called the vertex—this is where the cupping glasses are usually placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And keep your hand there, don't uncover the bone, because the patient will feel great pain here unlike with any of the other cauterizations on their head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I will tell you about this particular cautery, because the cautery with which we treat the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than that used for treating the vertex, and this is its shape.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of non-ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When eventually a hard pain arises in the back of the head or an extended pain inside the eye, first evacuate with medicines that change the humors and administer the other cures I have mentioned for different illnesses; and if all these don't help, then cauterization is done in two ways: either with sharp medicine that burns, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	More so a burning medicine [is] the pointed cautery which you take with garlic, and burn it and cut its ends on both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the painful area on the temple with a lancet until you find the spot where the [vein] is located, even if it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then tie him down with tight compression and leave it like that for three hours; then untie him and take away the garlic, leaving the wound open for two or three days; and then put on him a poultice soaked in warm wine until the place heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with ointment once it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	More so the cauterization with iron is done in this way: ignite the following type of cautery:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called the 'claw caustic', because its head is like a nail with a curved shape, and in the middle of it there is a small elevation.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand on the painful area, making sure not to stick to the bowstring which is underneath, and rotate the small tool gradually with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of skin stuck to the edges of the wound is such that half of it has adhered, raise your hand carefully so as not to stick to or damage the artery underneath, ensuring there is no loss of blood flow.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then dip a cloth in salt water and place it on the affected area for three days. Afterwards, apply a moistened bandage and heal with ointment until fully healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish to cauterise with the knife edge according to the standard method of cauterisation, be careful not to accidentally incise this relatively new artery.
Capitol quart.	The fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterisation of an old wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an old wound using the methods previously mentioned for initial treatment and those outlined in the classification of illnesses, but the patient does not improve or if the illness exceeds what we have said regarding first cauterisation with medicine or hot iron, then it is necessary that you light the knife-like cautery instrument so that it glows white-hot. Place this on the painful area along the length of half a finger (or any other appropriate measurement), and place your hand over once to prevent sticking before incising the bowstring and reaching bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I shall come back to the recollection of the regimen for accidental bleeding from archery according to its manner, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not respond to the aforementioned cautery and you find the patient's condition tolerable, cauterize them in the middle of their head as we have recounted earlier, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you administer the cautery as we have mentioned in the chapter on stretching archery injuries with two small cauteries, this method is better and more effective.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain." 
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to swelling and it is treated with laxative remedies and other treatments mentioned earlier in this section, but the pain persists, use the cautery method called "puncta," which I will describe as follows: [Description of the cauterization procedure].
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then apply the cauterizing flame directly [to the affected area], moving it all around the entire ear like a wheel in motion or focusing on each individual spot if the pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Gently lead the cautery tool from the base of the ear towards its tip, taking care to mark each spot as you go along with precision and caution.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you apply the cautery at ten points all around the ear, let it cool and then treat each spot individually until they are completely healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6: [Title or topic of discussion in this chapter]
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the Cauterization of Torture. 
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Certainly! Let's start with the translation of the first source sentence: 
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Here is my translation of the provided text into English:
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this type of torture with herbs, purgatives, and rinses, and your treatment is not successful, it is advisable to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: The first should be at the root of their ear, the second just below their temple, and the third at the junction of their two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for relief is found only in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is to apply the cautery directly on the tip of the ear at a point slightly above its highest peak, and another one below the temple; make it as long as your thumb, and keep your hand with the cautery in place until half of that length has been burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the shape of the cautery, which is like that of a small knife; its tip is flat.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	It may be more effective to have one that is slightly less sharp; you should hone it on a whetstone, just enough to reduce its excessive thickness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with something that has previously been proven effective until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua." 
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	Under these circumstances when apoplexy is old and you have treated it as we said before but the patient doesn't get better and has no fever, then cauterize him with four cauteries: on all corners of his head; with a cautery in the middle of his head, like we said; and another one at the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The way to use the cautery is done as previously mentioned.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	He has already been cauterized over the mouth of his stomach, which is more posterior (further back), and then he was treated with what you will find next.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8: On the Treatment of Apoplexy in Children.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the forgetfulness caused by flame cauterization.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient at first large cups of wine and pills that modify his brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the patient's whole head and put on his nape an ointment made of wax described in the treatise about ointments.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And leave it there for a few days; that is how to cauterize (burn).
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to that doctor's order which I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	So if it cures him with that treatment; if not, then make three cauterizations on the back of his head for him, which descend from the upper part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place something as thick as your finger between each cauterization, then treat the cauterized area with a substance that has been prepared.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you see that the patient is tolerating it well, then make a cauterization in the middle spot; but if there is greater tolerance, cauterize both sides of his head.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that area until it is healed; make sure the olive-oil based ointment is applied as previously instructed.

Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col. Capitol .x.	Chapter 10: Treating Eye Disorders
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	You must modify the patient's brain at the beginning with years of treatment, and the other cure we mentioned in the division is when the sickness is great and tolerates the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	If it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargles and chewables that modify the brain for several days beforehand with good food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous method, and another cautery on their occipital bone, and cauterize each corner of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	If the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize them with the cauteries I mentioned, while paralyzing and softening their body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And apply the olive oil cautery as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then apply a gentle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt, moist humors and a weak spirit, then cauterize it with the cauteries we have mentioned in cases of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess that turns into melancholy and the patient's body is humid, then give them something to drink which purifies their brain according to what has been mentioned in the previous section.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, then make a proper tortoise-shell wig and place it on their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	If the patient is 60 years old and has an intermittent fever.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; it is more appropriate to use an old sheep's horn.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that up over a fire for moderate heating, which they say it can bear when put on it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then bring that to the middle of their head in a circle, and leave it there so it can cool down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week along with their other treatments until they are healed; or if you wish, cauterize that place making small punctures according to its size, but be sure to hold in your hand a cautery arranged like this: this type of cautery moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then place that piece of frozen wax on ivy leaves or goose feathers.

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Regarding the water descending into the vein for cauterization.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have determined the start of water in the vein by the signs I've mentioned before, then begin and give the patient to drink something that will change their head, keeping it away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have him sit in warm water baths for a few days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head and cauterize that spot with a cautery on the top of his head; then cauterize it again with two cauteries over both temples if there is an outbreak of water from both ears, or just one side if the water is coming out of only one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Apply a cautery to all the veins and arteries that are under your patient's neck, but let these cauterizations be as far away from the temples in latitude as possible.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of any bleeding while you are cauterizing them; and if you see some blood flowing from him or her, stop it with any medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I have come with the knowledge that is in extraction of arteries, and removal thereof as well as cautioning against bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes you will be cauterizing the neck below the two bones with two fresh cauteries.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses. Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of bad smell from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar. De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the soothing cautery for the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is its form:" (followed by a description of the tool's shape).
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish to cauterize the area above both eyebrows with two small ones on either side, and let them extend from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be adjusted according to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press the cautery with your hand too much; rather, adjust according to the amount that the soft part of the eyelid adheres.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	When the eyelids of the patient are converted into scales and his eyes become inflamed.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the scales on the patient's eyelids are converted and they develop painful eyes, cauterization can be done in two ways: either by using fire or caustic medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you are using cauterization with fire, ask the patient to extend their eyelids as if they were cleaning them, making sure they are stretched and tightened. And while doing this procedure, ensure that you cover their eyes with a bandage so that they do not get hurt until the scales have formed.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once the scales are formed and tightened, place the patient's head in your lap, then make a mark on their eyelids with a sign that resembles the shape of a myrtle leaf, ensuring it starts near the scales.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply a hot cotton cloth soaked in an egg white albumen or powdered feather poultice on the eyelids.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the pointed cautery, which has this shape." 
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Under the drawing you have marked, cauterize little by little in small dots so that the surface of the skin blisters just like a myrtle leaf, exactly as it appears.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of the success of your work is that you see the eyelid of the patient contract and their hair stand up due to the puncture you made on them.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Then lift your hand and let go of them for three days, and then place a splint on their arm so that the fracture is elevated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure her with ointment until she is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hair returns for any reason and the eyelid softens, then do the cauterization again on it just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair is on their eyelid, then cauterize it until it rises to its natural place and smoothes out so that the hair does not irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	If you are using a caustic cautery with medicine, instruct the patient to pluck the hair so that it is longer and smoother; then cut out of cloth the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger over the medicine and press it slightly, but do not let go until the patient feels the burning sensation of the medicine, for this burning is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Once you perceive that the patient feels the desired burning sensation, then remove your finger from the medicine and use your little finger to take away any excess; once the burning stops, remove the medicine and wash the area with water. Then examine whether the eyelid has been lifted properly during this washing process - if not, apply a hot compress or make an incision, as that will be beneficial. If it still does not improve, return to the medicine and apply it again on the same spot where you did not press before, being careful not to damage your work or disfigure the eye.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a bandage over the wound to prevent infection and promote healing, and treat it with an ointment or other suitable remedy until it is fully healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is important for you to exercise great care and vigilance during your treatment, ensuring that none of the medicine falls into the eye. If, after a few days, the eyelid becomes softened or any hair causes irritation in the eye, then repeat the application of your medicine on the area where the eyelid has been softened, following the same process as before. Then keep an eye on them until they are healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Here is my best attempt at translating your provided text into English: 
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the way of healing from one who has studied this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye." 
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods we have discussed in the previous section on diseases and the treatment does not take effect, it is necessary to cauterize that area in the following manner: instruct the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have one of your assistants hold the patient's head gently but firmly between their hands so as to prevent any discomfort or agitation.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a poultice made of bird lime or feather mucus on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then ignite this specific type of cautery, which has the following shape...
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	...it should be concave like the quill of a reed or an eagle's feather, with the cauterization end being made sharp.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you intend to penetrate deeper into the body, do so from the other end (of the cautery).
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to emerge as it entered, do so with precision.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave design is better suited for your purpose.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then compress the open fistula, striving to clean and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it (the wound) and extract its pus.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the cauterization tool over him, which is well ignited; and have your hand close to his nose so that you do not miss with your hand or cause any inconvenience to the patient. Then put the cautery on the wound and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cauterization process the bone is perforated, it's fine; but if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice as needed. Leave it like that for three days and then put a piece of cloth on top of it until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	However, if eleven days have passed and it is still not healed, then apply a corrosive medicine on top of the wound until the bone becomes visible; then scrape it according to what you find appropriate in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	There is another way to cauterize a fistula which the ancients used to say: enter the place of the fistula and open it; then put in that opening something very thin like animal thread, whose shape is similar to the following one. Then put into the opening an ounce of melted lead; have your hand well-covered with wax so as not to hurt the patient when putting the lead inside his wound, since the lead would enter easily due to its softness and it could harm him by reaching to the bone. It is necessary that you cover his wound with a cotton cloth soaked in albumen or water, because the lead can fixate well on the fistula's place and it will heal miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have mentioned about cauterization and treatment, it is good. But if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal discharge and reduce the fistula back into the nose according to its proper place.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the anal fissure."

Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fractures with what we have mentioned in the previous sections and your treatment does not yield any improvement, then proceed to use the small cutting cautery as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the delicacy of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that thin edge of the knife carefully into those fractures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fracture.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Regarding cautery treatment for fistulas in the mouth." 
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms on the uvula or palate or between the teeth, causing pain and breaking open, becoming old and suppurating, with pus draining and forming a fistula, but you fail to cure it properly, then you must apply a cautery of fire according to its size in the opening of the fistula, insert the hot iron into the tract with your hand until it reaches the root of the infection or twice as deep, and treat this condition as described for healing.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	If the wound is shallow and heals well, then it is fine as is. Otherwise, it is necessary to uncover the area and expose the corrupted bone, which will be addressed in its respective chapter.

De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When veins are softened due to humidity and teeth become decayed, and you treat them with medicine but see no improvement, then place the patient's head in your lap, prepare a cautery of the shape that will be described next, quickly insert the hot iron into the tooth cavity, and hold your hand steady for just a moment until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, then repeat the cauterization a few times depending on what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour; then spit out this liquid because rotting tooth is sealed, softened gum is contracted and corrupt moisture is dried.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or the patient is cold or weak, and you cannot treat it with medicine, then cauterization in that area should be done in two ways: either by using a cow's horn or by fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization using a cow's horn involves taking a cow's horn and boring a hole in its tip with an iron rod; then take a cotton wick and wrap it around the pointed end of the horn, immerse this prepared horn into boiling water, and place it quickly on the painful tooth until it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then repeat this process several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But when it comes to cauterization with fire, you must pay attention to the size of the tube or iron rod used, and ensure that there is no excessive redness or intensity of the fire reaching the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery according to its intended form, and place it on the tooth while keeping your hand over it until the cautery cools down; perform this action a few times as the pain will be exacerbated either that day or the following one.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	Ensure that, due to the pressure of the cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good spittle and holds it there for an hour before spitting it out; this is how the form of the cautery should be.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize with whatever you see fit for the extremities, as best as you are able.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the tube/cannula:" (presumably followed by an illustration or further description)

De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of vocal cords and the treatment of seizures.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity affects the lungs, especially when it is accompanied by a cold constitution, it is necessary to evacuate the patient at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the affected area near the larynx.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	Ensure that you do not apply the cautery directly to the larynx, nor burn its skin, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	Cauterize the area with another pointed tool at the junction of their neck in the last vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	Let the previous method serve as a guide for this cauterization process.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him with what has been prescribed before he is healed.

De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization for pulmonary disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and pulmonary disease are caused by damp humors, and the patient has no fever or cough, and it is an old illness, then cauterize that person with two cauteries on the breastbone at the spots below the nipples and between them; and use another cautery in the middle of the foot between two bones; let the cautery be nailed according to the manner described.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your cauterization may be done by puncturing with the cautery called 'puncta', whose form was described previously in the section on treating ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And if you cauterize within the hairs on those spots, then treat him with that which is described previously for healing.

De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of titillic, which is the head of the penis.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then take the cautery with two ends; this is its shape:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Then cauterize the vein until it penetrates on one side to the other; and there will be a figure-of-eight shape with two ends of the cautery.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And it is subtle according to the size of the vein; this is its shape:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is appropriate to follow this count, as there are eight (*.viii*.) cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	Then place on the cautery a cloth soaked in salt, and then ensure that the patient is at rest, and their limb should not be moved for some time until it has healed.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is in the joints and this has been done late, then cauterize over the muscle with a single pointed cautery or multiple small cauteries, as the joint will be confirmed, moisture will be driven out, and the patient will recover.
