De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquella aia fayta.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the beginning of their medical discourse.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	When there is a hernia in the groin of a patient, it should be avoided to extract the epiploon, as all the veins and major blood vessels are situated nearby.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	For those who have boils or abscesses in the mouth, throat, or ears, and when the disease is not concentrated there, it is necessary to use the sectioning of the omentum to prevent further damage caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, it is necessary to incise the omentum below three of its circles or with four small sections across its width in between two circles for quantity. The incision should be made in a straight line and not into the cartilage; this area is suitable for sectioning as it lacks flesh and has few blood vessels.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	If the doctor is cautious, they should extend the chain of the throat with an ounce and then split it until reaching the channel; however, they must avoid the blood vessels if there are any nearby.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then make the incision in the channel as we have described; it is important to be precise about the sectioning of this area because any mistake can lead to hoarseness and vocal cord damage.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	When the time comes that the opening is considered dangerous, add two lips to the edges of the wound, and stitch only if it involves cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicines that promote flesh generation until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the summary of this discourse which we have recounted is not an exposition but rather cautionary tales about how some of these abscesses may have already penetrated the patient's throat, and the patient has come back from death, and their pulse has been restored, and in some cases they make incisions into the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe at the site of the wound and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason, I will command to leave the wound open until the evil of the disease is consumed; and its evil lasts for three days; then I will command to dress the wound, and it shall be healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have witnessed with my own eyes is that a servant pressed a cooking fork into her throat and made an incision in part of the lung's membrane, and I was called upon for its cure; it then emitted a sound like that of the dead moaning, and I discovered the wound and stopped the small amount of blood that was issuing from the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that she had not cut a vein or artery, and the wind went out of her body, and I healed her before being cured.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the servant did not die but rather became hoarse in her voice; after some days she returned to better health.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that there is no fear in the section of the throat.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Regarding the incision on abscesses that occur on the neck outside of it; they are called hernias of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called a throat hernia is a large abscess according to the body's coloration and it often occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	It [the abscess] is of two types: either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	In the case of the natural one, it cannot be cured.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accidental one is of two types: the first being similar to fatty lumps, and the other type is akin to abscesses caused by blocked arteries; this [last one] evokes fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not presume to use iron instruments on him unless he is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	You proceed to examine it and investigate it with your hands, and if you find it similar to a fatty tumor, and it is not suspended by any veins, then you cut into it like the knots, and extract it along with whatever contains its hair and subcutaneous tissue; but if not, then you thoroughly inspect all that is in it, and then treat the area with what is necessary for healing until it is completely cured.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the cutting of different types of knots/tumors.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are several varieties of tumors, and I have already mentioned all their different types in the division [of this treatise].
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And I wish to explain again the difference between a tumor and an ulcer in case there is any doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	So I say that with an ulcer there is heat and fever and violent pain while the superfluous matter [pus] is boiling up; but when this ceases to boil over, then the fever, the pain, and the heat all subside as well.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But if there is no heat or fever and it's not painful, then consider that this swelling belongs to the lion, which has its own sack.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body; its beginning is like a cyst and is formed just as in cows, whether big or small, and they are of two types: either fatty and containing moisture, whose colors are varied, as I mentioned in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	So now, when you reach the treatment of swellings, first examine it and probe it at its beginning with an instrument called a "introimes", according to how its shape will appear in the following chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	This is the method of examination for abscesses and all swellings: you take this instrument and insert it into the wettest part that you find in the abscess, then rotate your fingers around it little by little until you feel that the instrument has already penetrated to its core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then close your hand according to the size of the abscess, remove the introimes, and consider what has come out in its track.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the running moisture is discharged, regardless of its color, then you make an incision on it superficially as I have mentioned for other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture present in the excrement, then you know it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	Dry it on them using a section that has the shape of a cross, following this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	As I taught you, suspend it with threads, and remove the membrane from all sides easily, keeping the skin or sack, if possible, on it, and extract that healthy flesh with the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is torn during the operation and you cannot extract that healthy part, you will have to remove it in pieces so as not to leave any cause for infection.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if there remains even the slightest or excessive cause, the infection will return as before.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you fear that a small portion will remain, then fill the wound with some sharp corrosive powder and press it firmly shut, placing on it a poultice of caustic medicine which acts as an antiseptic, healing that part through another treatment until it is completely healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	If the infection is large, then you must sew its two lips together and treat it with flesh-forming medicine.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node. The ends of these scalpels that have been made sharp are pointed, and the other ends are not pointed; they are arranged in this manner, not only so that it may be done with ease when cutting away knots (or swellings) for fear of dividing a vein or nerve, but also because by means of these the patient is cured and a little comforted by the burning which again prevents an abscess from forming.

De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that develop beneath the ears are a type of scrofula, hard and containing pus.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some of these abscesses contain moisture; for those with moisture, it is necessary to make an incision during the lunar phase, as shown in this diagram: from point G to point B. Once you have evacuated all the pus from the abscess, fill it with old courtly and let it heal over the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	Then keep the courtly in place and treat it with appropriate ointment until it is completely healed.

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On incisions for abscesses that occur on the arteries or veins.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And he who is affected by the vein will be rounded at the appearance of the heart.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	Making an incision on this abscess is a mistake, especially if it is located near the armpits, shoulders, neck, or any vital part of the body; and if it is very large, its cure with iron should be avoided, as well as for those located in the extremities or head.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	However, for the one who suffers due to the inflammation of the orifice of the bowels, make a section in the loin; then open this section with hooks and expose the bowels, freeing them from their coverings.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And place a needle on that side and make it penetrate to the other side, pressing the bowels with a double-pronged probe in two places - this causes you to extract two intestines located in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Then strike the area that is between two ligatures with a spatula until all blood contained in it comes out and the abscess dissolves.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And apply a cure that generates pus until the ligatures fall off; then treat that with appropriate ointments for its condition until it heals.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	Here is my translation of the provided source sentence: 
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then place on them a pillow that you have soaked in wine and oil, and proceed to administer the cure which is made with calf's bile and ointments until they are healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1: On abscesses that occur due to nerve damage.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as abscesses can occur in muscles and veins, similarly, abscesses can form in nerves when there is excessive strain or injury due to overexertion.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	Most often, they occur in the locations of the flexor muscles or the ankle, or any place where joints are weakened.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe abscess, resembling the colour of the rest of the body, and it appears in their limbs; when it is intense, the patient experiences a similar stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	The abscess does not reach the heart, and thus it is manageable; it is weakened in all parts but does not affect the front or back regions.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Those abscesses which occur in the joints should not be treated with iron [instruments], for they will soon contract.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If it is a small abscess, then take the scissors and cut it out from its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, suspend it with a string, peel it away, and place it (the abscess) aside. Then sew the wound together using stitches and treat the injury until it has healed.
Capitol .li.	It appears that you are referencing section 11 of this medieval medical text. If you provide me with the relevant text, I will be happy to translate it for you!
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Regarding the incision of an abscess that occurs on the cheek, which then affects the stomach.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Try to remove the moles that appear on their stomachs and other parts of their bodies, which are called funguals due to their resemblance to mushrooms. The root of these moles is delicate while its head is thick; sometimes the edges are turned outwards, some are small in size, and others quite large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one such case where two of these growths appeared on their stomach and resembled mushrooms; there was no difference between them in terms of whiteness or the delicacy of their roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And sometimes the edges were turned inwards, causing them to crack open with humidity constantly oozing from it.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised them and drew out from one foot eighteen ounces, and from the other six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And during the operation and incision of theirs, consider it now if the patient is humid, and the color of their hernia is white, humid, with fine roots; then you shall incise them with a wide spatula, and have your cauteries heated in the fire, for many times their section has to expel much blood; and if you see the blood, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient is fearful and timid, beware of incising with an iron instrument; rather take some fresh leaden seal, and attach it to that hernia in the manner we have described; leave it there for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust the tightness of the lead wire; therefore, do not cease to tighten that great lead until it is cut and falls off by itself due to its work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if it is of thick roots, then its incision has some cause for fear and apprehension, especially when it is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is also possible for you to divide him in half and then cauterize that part so it does not grow back.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then treat the inside until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to cut into that which is of a dark color, with little feeling, and has thin walls, for it is indeed cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come to you with the reminder of suffering as well.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment for an umbilical hernia." 
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le cual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a rupture of the diaphragm and hernia, then the color of the abscess resembles that of flesh; there is no pain, but rather it appears in various parts.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to the protrusion of the intestine, then its position will be different from what we have described, with much more variety, and when you press on it with your hand as mentioned earlier, it hides itself, only to return; it has great difficulty and requires extensive bathing and hard work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to humidity, then there is no pain, and when you press on it with your hand, it does not hide or retract, nor is it believed to be an issue.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then with these signs the abscess appears black in color.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to flesh matter, then the abscess is severe, thick, hard, and found in a certain quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to gas, then touching it causes pain.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is to be considered when the protrusion of the navel is due to blood from an artery, or a vein, or gas; in which case you should refrain from treating it, as there is danger and fear involved, just as I have taught you in the chapter where I discussed abscesses caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent. E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have removed the cloth, then take a thread; and cut away its superfluities.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas. De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of fractures." 
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	Here is my translation of the provided text:

Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	When it is old and severe, you should not attend to him as I cannot cure such an illness nor have seen anyone else do so.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on him is when he is positioned as we have said; you should proceed and place the patient [so], then purge them of black bile a few times, and bleed them if there is an evident fullness found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient for the operation where he is located, and forbid them from making sudden movements; then excise with curved scissors all parts with a good deep incision until no cause of his roots remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let the blood run out, and do not stop it lightly; press on the areas [of incision], and wipe away the thick blood with your hand or an instrument that is available to you from the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you find any thick blood from the incision of a vein or artery difficult to manage, then cauterize it until the flow of blood has ceased; then treat him with another cure so that he may be cured.

De curacio de ydropici.	De curacio de ydropici." 
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	Here is my translation of the sentence: 
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo. Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient with an excess of vigor and no other illness except for dropsy alone, and he is neither a child nor old, then the method of operation is as follows: lift the patient between your arms, and have the attendant squeeze his belly by hand, forcing water out below the navel; next take a spine-shaped spatula like this:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It has two long sharp edges, with a sharp point like a spatula, but slightly shorter so that in the operation it does not enter or cut into the intestine.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	Then consider if the cause of dropsy is from the intestines; in that case, you must make an incision about three fingers' breadth below and to the right of the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the cause of dropsy is from kidney disease, then your incision should be three fingers to the left of the navel.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its cause is from the spleen, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And be sure not to make the incision on the side that the patient prefers, because superfluities might run to that place and heal it falsely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Here is the translation of the provided source sentence: 
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then I pierce the navel so that the spatula reaches the empty place, and it is the water's location.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that [object] and insert an instrument of this shape:" 
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	It is similar to a thin silver tube/cannula; it is made of silver or bronze (eram) or lion brass (latten), at its lower part there is a small hole and on the sides are three holes: two on one side and one on the other. The end of it is cut oblique in the same manner as quill pens, like so.
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	On the uppermost end of it is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, then that immediately rises over the instrument and evacuates an equal amount of water from the hour glass. If you evacuate more than what fits into the hour glass, very lightly does the patient die due to resolution of their vital spirit or suffers a fifth approach which is close to death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	One evacuates that amount according to the quantity of his virtue and according to what the condition of the patient means to you as well as the value of his pulse and state.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then extract the instrument and retain the water, which is caused by it being immediately retained by the cord that holds the hole which is over the cipher of which you have perforated according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	Here is my translation of the provided source sentence: 
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat. E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, and use a poultice along with the extraction of water, just as I have recounted in what has preceded.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the healing of children who are born with their urine passage unpierced.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some infants are born from their mother's womb, and the head of their penis is not pierced or is too narrow to function properly.
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, the surgeon should make an incision on it as soon as it is born with a very thin, sharp knife in this manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then place within the orifice a fine lead peg and bind it there for three days, or if need be four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, let him do so while being kept bound; then replace it.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not place the lead there, it is possible that the urine which runs over that spot may prevent the opening of the foreskin.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	For him whose foreskin is too narrow must be treated with a lead peg, as we have said, for several days until it has healed.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	Moreover, those in whom the testicle is not in its place are called 'ectopic', which occurs when one who is born with this defect has the head of the penis cut off because he cannot urinate at the inner parts, while lifting his penis by hand to the outer parts; and there is no generation for him, since semen cannot reach the uterus properly, and it is a very serious illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	The way to perform the operation on him is that the patient should be placed on his back, and then extend his penis with your left hand using a strong pull, and cut off the head of the glans from its place under the prepuce with a sharp knife, like cutting feathers, or whatever you don't cut any part so that the middle of the penis, similar to the glans, and the testicle fall into their proper places.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	Be careful during your bloodletting operation, as this sometimes happens: stop the bleeding with something and treat the wound until it is healed.

De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Here is my translation of your provided text:
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of these two, one is malignant while the other isn't.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	For the latter [the non-malignant one], suspend a fine thread and cut it off until you reach where all its substances are removed; then place upon it an Egyptian ointment-soaked piece of cotton wool, and finally treat it with an ointment made of *Diaphinicon* so that it may heal.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the inflammation is malignant with a blackish colouration, then you must apply a cautery after the incision and to its edges.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	However, if the inflammation is on the head of an uncircumcised penis, and one part of it lies beneath the foreskin while another outside of it; then you must remove that which lies inside at its beginning until it is solidified; then treat the exterior [part], for when you treat what is between the foreskin, there isn't a guarantee that it won't be split.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if you notice this happening in the eyelids and the foreskin [with] blackness or ulceration, then it is necessary that you dig out everything which has already turned black and is on its way to be corrupted or has been corrupted; then apply over it a mix of honey with a powder made from pomegranate rind and crushed and sieved earthworms.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then treat the other treatment while it is still fresh until he is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	If there is indeed an outflow of blood, then apply the lunar caustic according to this method:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	As the beneficial caustic has two uses together, it is for the flow of blood and for corruption in wounds.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corroded and destroyed immediately, then you must insert a lead cannula into the foreskin so that the patient urinates through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the case of adherence between the foreskin and the head of the penis (and this happens only to those who have no foreskin, circumcision is not required; it may also happen due to infection or abscess) you must remove it with a blunt spatula until the bond is dissolved and the head of the penis is released from all adhesion.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them precisely, then you must remove some tissue with the spatula at the border between the head of the penis and foreskin; this is because, when the foreskin is thin, its slight thinness can be easily pierced.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then carefully separate the foreskin from the head of the penis using fine silk thread, which has already been moistened in cold water so that it does not stick again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then clean the wound with styptic wine until it becomes consolidated (healed).
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 7.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the cleansing of children and the treatment of those who have undergone circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not merely a remedy for bodily continuity like other wounds; rather, since it originates from our action and will, and its necessity pertains specifically to children, we must assign to it the most careful treatment and gentle process that conduces to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, they say that the ancients do not mention circumcision in any of their books, as it was not practiced according to their laws. It is only through experience that we have adopted this practice, which I attribute to the majority of surgeons and barbers performing circumcisions and cleansing with a novaculite stone and lancets, and using animal sinew for binding and the fingernail for cutting.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	I have already tried all these methods and found no better way to cleanse than with scissors and binding using animal sinew. Cleansing with the fingernail is not ideal as it often cuts too deep, as the foreskin has two layers of skin, and cutting through both necessitates another incision and sure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And the cleansing which is done with alphecati and is digital, like what shoemakers use, does not secure the incision of the extremity of the male member because it easily enters its tract.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	However, during the operation, take care not to touch iron, for it may easily ruin your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the child's penis is short by nature, and many times it happens that way without needing any treatment, and I have witnessed such cases.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But regarding the treatment done with scissors and a thread, which is beneficial, I have discovered through experience that the scissors provide proportional incision because the sharpness above is just as much as the one below; thus when you press your hand, two sharp edges are provided in proportion, and the incision is made simultaneously within a short time; it is secured by compressing the thread around the penis's shaft with a figure preventing any movement at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	The way the first operation is done is to make the child understand if he has any sense at all and just tie a thread around his penis but not too tight, leaving him like that until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make sure he is comforted in every possible way, adapting this to his level of understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	Then have him sit between your arms and be ready to act quickly; let there be no hesitation or delay. Hide the scissors in your hand or under your foot, so that the child does not see them or any other instrument.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then insert your hand into his penis and blow into the urethra; draw out whatever is causing an obstruction until you see the head of the penis emerge. Then clean it thoroughly to remove any dirt or foreign matter.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	Then bind the marked spot with a double cord; below this tie another small one, and then place your finger on top of that with firm pressure to secure the knot. Finally, cut off the ends between the two knots.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then raise the urethra gently and extract the head of the penis. Allow the blood to drip out slowly, as this is preferable; apply powder over it and cover the powder with a cloth that has been soaked in hot chicken broth flavored with recent rose oil. Leave this on until the next day, and treat it with healing ointment until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps has been modified, this is how it looks:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	One end of the forceps is blunt and the other is sharp; ensure that the branch (or handle) does not split, and maintain an equal length for both sharp ends and handles.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	However, the mistake in modification is that one may accidentally omit the intrinsic chain (or ligament) entirely or partially during the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, be sure to stretch the ligament of your finger over the wound opening and make an incision according to its shape.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then use a hook to extract the ligament and make an incision.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	However, if three days have passed and there remains inflammation beneath the penile wound, then you should wait until the abscess is ripe, cut it open with ease, and make an incision as prepared.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And be careful not to touch the head of the penis with it, for you must avoid that.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore, cure that which has been afflicted by the plague with the powders we have mentioned in the treatise of powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it has been cut from the leg above measure, and you obey the instructions given to them, they will not harm us.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And more cure that which we have said within it shall be healed.
Capitol .lviii.	It seems like you are providing me with numbered sections or chapters of this medieval medical treatise. Would you like me to continue translating the text? Please provide the next section, and I will gladly assist you further.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the cure for retained urine in the bladder." 
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Certainly! Here is a line-by-line translation of the medieval medical treatise into English: 
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	Here is my translation of the sentence you provided: 
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, when the neck of the bladder is constricted and there is expulsion of stones to the back passage, it results in the complete release of urine.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with what we have said and the cause is severe on the patient, then you must administer extraction using an instrument called a syringe, which has this form: It should be made of silver and have a thin, hollow tube like that of a bird's feather, with a length similar to one and a half palms. This slender pipe should be at its head.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	The method of extracting urine through this is as follows: Take a bent tube and wrap it with thread or string for a good binding; insert the end of the tube into the area below the syringe, and use scissors to cut away any superfluous causes of the wrapping. Then, forcefully place it inside the cannula and extend the syringe with a piece of wood and egg white.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	Have the patient sit on a saddle-like structure, and anoint their scrotum and penis with moist oils, olive oil, and ointments.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; 
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then stretch the bile little by little with wool, for urine is like wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that and make a urine cure, use a syringe, do not stop doing this and keep using the syringe until the bladder is evacuated, and the patient finds relief again.
Capitol .lix.	It seems you are referring to section or chapter 59 of this medieval medical treatise. Is there any specific text from this section that I can translate for you?
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	On the quality of bladder irrigation with enema bulbs or similar instruments suitable for this purpose.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When an ulcer or abscess occurs in the bladder, or when blood has clotted there, or if pus is obstructed, and you want to introduce water and medicine into it, then use an instrument called a "clampcedra," and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	However, at its end it should be closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three openings: two on one side, equally spaced.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is a concave place where the water is poured in and according to how much is introduced into it, you add more until when for some reason it is drawn out of the moisture, let it be withdrawn; and when it is expelled, let it be pulled with force, and when thrown far, this is what an enema bulb does which is filled with naphtha in naval battles.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to remove moisture from the bladder, insert the end of the catheter into the moisture and draw it with water that is poured above it, for the moisture is drawn into the catheter's cavity.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	Then insert the end of the catheter into the penis as we have described in the surgery section, and pour water to push the moisture out because that humidity will reach the bladder immediately, and the patient will feel it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The shape of this subtle instrument by which the bladder is catheterized is as follows:" (followed by a description or illustration of the catheterization tool). 
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or iron, with its top part similar to a small feather, and gently insert it inside him." 
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take a bladder of meat, place the moisture you wish to crystallize in it, and tie that bladder well with a double ligature made of gallbladder, heating this liquid over a flame.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	Then insert the end of the crystallizer into the bladder.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then press your hand firmly over the bladder containing the liquid, keeping it stretched out until the patient feels that the moisture has reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	If you do not have a bladder at hand, take a piece of parchment and make a circle from it; perforate this throughout its roundness; then insert gallbladder strongly into those holes, as if you were rolling it up; next add the circle thus rolled to a bag made of skin, since you put in it that which you wish of liquids, oils, and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then tie it to the instrument and do so as you did with the bladder, squeezing it by hand until the moisture reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the extraction of stones (or rock). 
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas," 
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have described the stone in which any operation with a knife takes place.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	The stone that is generated in the bladder itself is the one that gets lodged there.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I am explaining this with clear exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	So I say that the stone formed in the bladder mostly affects children; and one of its symptoms is that the urine expelled from the bladder resembles water in its subtlety, and appears cloudy; and the patient scratches their genitals, and often cries out, and it is then they pierce the buttocks with many such objects.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is rare for the cure to be successful in children of that age who have attained 14 years; and it is a difficult cure in the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	For them, perhaps, it may be half as effective because they are young.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And for him whose stone is larger, the cure is more difficult; if it is small, it is the opposite.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Thus, when we come to the cure of this, it is necessary at the beginning to modify the patient by making them drink a crystal that extracts all the wind from their intestines; for sometimes this wind prevents the expulsion of the stone due to its investigation.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	Certainly! Here is the translated text: 
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make him stop between your prepared hands, and his hands are under his thighs, so that the whole bladder is made to incline towards the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then take her out entirely from there.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	So if you feel the stone in the space, then cut quickly with a section over it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if it does not come out completely with your touch, then you must grease your left index finger with oil if the patient is a child, or your middle finger if they are an adult, and insert that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And take out the stone before it is below your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And turn it little by little towards the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on it with your finger, and expel it to the outside parts away from the place of the incision.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	Command the assistant to press on the bladder with their hand; and command another assistant to use their right hand to stretch the testicles away from above, and with their other hand to hold back the penis which is below the testicles, in the part of the place where the incision is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then introduce a spatula with this shape: 
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	Divide it in the area between the anus and the scrotum, not in the middle but towards the left side of the hip; make sure that your finger can fit into this incision, which should be made over the said stone and in the anus, with a transversal cut so as to allow for a wide opening on one end and a narrow entrance on the other according to how much the stone has descended there, but no larger because it will press too hard against your finger that is inside the anus near the stone, which may hinder its extraction.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that some stones have angles and edges which make their removal difficult.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And the other kind of stone is similar to a lentil; it's round, and its extraction is easier.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	So if that one has edges or angles, adapt it to the cavity (or fissure).
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not so smooth, cover the surface with wax or wrap a string around it properly, the end of which should be like a file for scraping against the stone and don't cease doing this; or introduce below an appropriate tool with a curved tip.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot manage this, then slightly enlarge the wound, and if you see blood flowing, quickly cut it off with a razor blade steeped in powdered sulphuric acid.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is larger than one, then at the beginning you must insert your hand into the bladder and cut it there; then push a little rod close to it; and do likewise when there are more than two stones.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, it is wrong to cut it with a wide incision, as this causes the patient one of two things: either death or continued discharge of urine, because the place has not yet healed completely.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But if any part is left behind, it should be expelled; or fashion a hook and extract the stone in pieces using forceps.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Once you have completed the operation, fill the wound with pieces of aloes and dragon's blood, then bind it tightly.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	Place on it a cloth steeped in oil and wine or in rose oil and water to prevent suppuration.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then turn the patient onto their back, and do not remove the bandage for three days.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	Once you have unbound them, dress the wound with water and warm oil, then treat it daily with refined ointment and diabolic ointment until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	However, if there is an acute, scalding, and corrosive plague that looks as though the blood in the bladder has been frozen, and due to this, urination is blocked (which is known from the expulsion of blood with urine), then insert your finger into the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains, it will cause a corruption of the bladder and its putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the plague with vinegar, water, and salt, and apply whatever remedies are appropriate for its cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	Cover the entire area of treatment, keeping both thighs together, securing the medicines you have applied there.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and located in the penis, having entered it with difficulty due to blocked urination, then treat it with what I have previously recommended to prevent cutting, for those who perform operations during this treatment are accused of being cutters; and I myself have experienced this, so let you take a steel borer like that which follows: 
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	From the triangular extremity, sharp, fixed in wood.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then take some flax, tie it to the verge under the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then introduce the iron into the verge, piercing it with ease until the piercer reaches that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the piercer with your hand in that stone gradually, piercing and passing it through until you make the other end penetrate; for urine is now released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	Then press your hand on what is rough from the stone outside of the verge, for it is cracked and pierced by urine; the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not adapted to your tool for any reason which prevents it from being used, then tie a flax under the stone and another one over the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And make an incision on the stone at that verge between two bindings.
E aprop extratz aquela.	Then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	Then untie the binding and modify the congealed blood which is done in a basin.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	It is not necessary to tie the stone with gallbladder bile, but rather to prevent it from returning to the bladder, and place the other binding above that, for when the gallbladder bile is released during the stone's extraction, the ureter returns to its position and captures the plague.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary that when you bind the gallbladder bile from above, you must lift the ureter in its upper parts, or else it will return to its original position and capture the plague again as we have mentioned.
