Forma de lu:	The form of the patient is as follows:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Form of the wound in which there is a cavity:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Form of another, more subtle wound:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Form of another wound with curved extremities:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Form of a small wound resembling a tent:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Form of an incision in which the bones have been cut:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Form of another, smaller incision:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another incision resembling a ray with its extremity like a saw and appearing in many places on the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of a ray that corresponds to the condition of the one whose bones have been perforated:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and has sharp points.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and resembles all the causes that we have mentioned regarding rays, incisions, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of extreme incision and of the perforation of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if it is due to the effects of certain poisonous creatures like the scorpion of the sea, or viper, or weever fish, and others of that kind.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or injury is at the tip of the finger, then you should cut into the finger and do not give any space for the corruption to spread deeper into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it affects the hand, you should cut into it from the base of the armpit, and do not allow any space for the corruption to take hold in the arm pit.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead it affects that region, then you should cut into the arm at the elbow joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption continues to spread and it surrounds the elbow, then this is often a sign of death for the patient; administering any other treatment besides this in an attempt at a cure would be futile.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, for the foot when the corruption affects beyond the toe, you should cut into it at one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the arch of the foot, then you should cut into the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if you can get your hand inside [the wound], then you cut open the leg at the joint of the knee.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the knee, then there is no treatment but dismissal; leave the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The way to cut open the limb or to sever it is that you tighten a ligature below the part where you wish to cut, and tighten another ligature above this location; extend one minister with a ligature towards the lower parts, and have another minister extend upwards with a ligature; then separate the flesh which lies between these two ligatures as you spread them apart until all the flesh is exposed; and then it may be cut or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And be sure to place a linen cloth over all parts so that it does not touch the wound itself, and have a bandage brought to bind the patient tightly while keeping the abscess closed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is a flow of blood while you work, then cauterize the wounded area accordingly or place some hemostatic powders on it to restrain the bleeding; and return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then bind the wounded limb with ligatures as you see fit, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption of acids primarily occurs in the area around the big toe that extends towards the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Then prepare the patient by applying more pressure to the affected area as they experience intense pain and burning sensation. Cut into that foot around the joint, and he was healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, there remained in him the same corruption on the finger of his right hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I had to pierce his finger back with what I had on my medical table, purifying his body; the superfluidity did not reverberate, and it started going towards another finger that began in his hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	He called upon me to cut open his hand, but I did not want to do it due to my concern about the reverberation of that superfluidity, and more so because I feared the outcome of cutting his dead hand, as the virtue of the patient was already fading.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he departed from me, he returned to his land and I heard that the man prepared himself and cut open his entire hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis." 
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs on any fleshy part of the body and its space is elongated to the point where it forms a collection of pus, then it breaks open and is perforated, releasing pus from within, leaving behind an empty cavity like that of a vessel, while the skin covering it remains as thin as cloth, having not yet reached advanced corruption stages, nor affecting the bone or nerves underneath, this condition is called a sinus, and it should not be named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the elongated space allows corruption to spread into any connected part of the body, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The cure for it is that you should cut out the entire affected skin layer while it's still intact and rolled up, especially if it resembles thin cloth and was formed from corruption, to ensure it does not stick back onto the wound due to its corrupt nature.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you wish for the skin to reattach and believe that the corruption has not progressed further, but rather there is a passage of air in the tissue, then your treatment should involve administering enemas to them.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider it to be a sinus condition, and the mass is large with an arm that emanates a foul odour, then administer to them enemas of Egyptian medicine made from oil, vinegar, and a resin called "ziniar," which has been mixed in equal parts and put into a vessel before being heated over fire until it thickens and acquires a honey-like consistency.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then remove that with disgust; do this for as many days until the sinus is cleansed and the pus has dried up.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	In some cases, an enema is administered with water and ashes when this medicine is not available to you; take the ash from wood, mix it with water, then use this mixture to perform the enema until you feel that the sinus has been cleaned.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient lacks tolerance for the Egyptian medicine or water with ashes, then use a mixture of water and honey combined with ground cinnamon for the enema; you may also use wine and honey mixed together, as honey cleanses and washes while the wine makes the sinus adhere and is especially helpful when there is an excess of astringency and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this a few times and are satisfied that the pus has dried up, then perform an enema with water that promotes flesh growth.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	Take some of the "unguentum diaphanicon" ointment and dissolve it in rose oil and astringent wine; or you may perform an enema with other medicines and ointments that possess properties which I have already written about in my treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the opening is wide, then you gather its lips with a suture and leave in it as much space as the amount of fluid that will be added for the enema.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the arm extends is elevated towards higher parts, then cauterize it at its lowest point so that the arm can pass through it, for when the arm is constricted in the depth of a sinew, flesh will form around it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to cauterize the sinew at its lowest point as desired, then prepare the member with a preparation that allows the arm to pass through slightly according to your ability and ensures there are no obstacles preventing the passage of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines, which you place on the sinew suitably for what you intend to do, extended onto a piece of linen cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	Let the cloth be of such a size that it covers all the sinew; then, with scissors, cut into the right side of the opening of the sinew an incision slightly larger than its own opening; and next extend over another small piece of linen cloth soaked in burning leonard's water according to the extent of the wound, and place this on top at some distance from the opening of the sinew so that it keeps the arm away and does not touch the large cloth until after several days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	Now for the one who is above the navel hole, you should keep them upright at all times to prevent anything from coming out of their arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know whether what runs from their arm is much or little, digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you should consider the area around the navel: whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is infected.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And if your treatment extends for a long time in this manner, and you see that the material placed over the navel hole has adhered there or formed an appropriate adhesion, then on either the second day or third day you should remove it; and when you remove the dressing, replace it with another cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if around the navel there is a small hollow filled with thin pus, then do not despair of any adhesion that may form here, for this is appropriate healing; just as some people take a long time to generate new flesh in their wounds, and others experience the opposite.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if after many days undigested matter still emerges from the navel, then you should know that adhesion has not occurred; and if there is a delay in the adhesion of the navel due to prolonged treatment, then adjust by using drying medicines, but if these are damp in substance or virtue, dry them out like an ointment of diachylon when too much oil has been added.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The last step to cure it is to take some unguent of *dya*finicon (not sure what this word means) and dissolve it in rose oil, then apply it onto them like a bandage over their wound as its substance becomes firm, and thus you will cure him/her with it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	It will appear as if you are performing the action when there is no arm, take some *dya*finicon unguent and honey, which have been heated until thickened, then use it; or alternatively, take myrrh and aloe with resin, crush them all together into a powder over the fire, afterwards spread this on a cloth and place that on the wound; as well as applying this mixture of honey, having thickened earlier, onto a cloth after pulverizing and placing it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes it is administered to them as *aristologia* (not sure what this word means) in long strips and roots of celestial lilies (which are the celestial lilies), along with flour of orache and centaurea, then use these simple ingredients either whole or ground up, crush them together and sieve to make a powder over the honey which you have warmed; finally apply it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the wound is prolonged and does not heal with this treatment, know that it has reached deeper layers of the body and may have already infected bones or other hard tissues/organs or even ligaments; in this case you should treat it with fistula therapy as described previously.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Here is my best attempt at translating the text line by line: 
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text:
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text:
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already spread to the bone, then it is necessary that you incise the bone and extract it, for there is no cure that can be found in a patient with a corrupted bone.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corruption spreading to the fingers and toes, then incise one of the knuckles depending on which digit is affected, and cure it before it fully heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if there is a blow or injury to the nail bed resulting in intense pain, then it is necessary to perform flebotomy on the patient at first, and then dry up the nail using a sharp spatula with a transverse section from above downward, taking care not to penetrate too deeply into the flesh beneath the nail, for this will cause great suffering to the patient and lead to the formation of superfluous scar tissue in the area; and treat that area with something that induces pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	This digit which is found in some people's hands is entirely made of flesh, and has little to no bone or nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some of these digits are found at the base of joints or their knuckles.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	May he who is born in any part of the finger not be sick, and may he who is born in the joints have light suffering.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are fleshy by nature, the incision is light, and you should cut their skin with a spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	May the recovery of someone born at the base of a joint be difficult; therefore, beware of cutting them.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	May he who is born on the finger at the knuckles need you to cut his flesh with a round incision into the bone; then close it with one of those saws suitable for this purpose, and heal him until he recovers.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	May the consolidation that occurs in fingers between their visible joints or due to the nature of man's birth, or because of hardened wounds or fire burns, or for similar reasons, then it is necessary to cut this consolidation until those fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place him between the sheets with rose oil for them not to be lightly consolidated, and separate those, or put a thin sheet of lead between them until it is properly consolidated.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre. De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	De inscizio de vices, so son varicas." 
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Here is my translation: 
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Now you should administer a purge for black bile from the heart several times with force, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of theirs with iron is according to two methods: one is that it be incised and the black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be raised and everything be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is done in this way: immerse the leg at its beginning in cold water until the thick blood is resolved, which comes from the leg, and then bind the patient's leg to the highest point of the thigh down to the lowest part with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place or two or three with an extensive incision, and then raise the black blood gently by hand from below the leg up, and from above downwards until the amount of blood you wish has been drawn and can withstand it, which is taking away the strength of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind it up, and command him to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by bloodletting when the veins are full, which will be noted by the patient.

E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And now cut the vein with a ligature at the right angle to its section on his side or in his back; you should do this near the hip or lower down towards the heel.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And now open the ligature with hooks and peel away all parts of the vein until it is visible to the eye, you should notice its appearance as it begins to darken.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so when you remove the ligature, if you see that it is white like a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you place under it the reed so that it is raised and turned away from the ligature, and suspend it with hooks above the lion.

E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela. E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	Here is the translation of the provided text:

E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Once all this has been done, place on the site of the wound a piece of cloth soaked in warm water and oil, both rose-scented and unscented, until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota. E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela. De extraccio venae cruris.	De extraccio venae cruris translates to "On drawing blood from the leg vein". This phrase likely refers to a medical procedure involving extracting blood from a specific vein in the leg, possibly for diagnostic or treatment purposes. It is an important step in medieval medicine and could be used to determine various health conditions.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs, found in low-lying lands like Al-Ategi in Arabic regions and in the lowlands of India with little vegetation or trees." This sentence provides an interesting geographical context to where this particular vein is commonly found within the human body. The description of these areas as "lowlands", "with little vegetation" and "arid" gives a clear image of the environments associated with the generation of this specific vein, which could potentially be useful for understanding its function or any potential health implications related to it.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	It is rarely generated in other parts of the body besides the legs." This statement indicates that, while this particular vein is commonly found in the legs, it is an exception rather than a rule as far as its distribution throughout the human anatomy is concerned. This could be relevant to medical practice and research, especially when studying the unique characteristics and functions of different veins within the circulatory system.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Its formation is due to the putrefaction that comes from below, just as poisonous substances enter the body through snakes, worms, frightening creatures, and maggots breeding in the dirt and flesh." Here, the text offers a rather gruesome explanation for the generation of this particular vein or possibly even the process of blood clotting. The mention of "putrefaction" and various "creatures" associated with decay paints a macabre picture, suggesting that the formation of this vein is linked to some sort of toxic or decaying environment within the body. This could potentially have implications for understanding the causes of certain medical conditions.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of its arrival is the sudden inflammation in the leg, and then the area becomes blistered; soon after, a vein begins to appear from that blistered spot, as if it were rooted like a plant." In this sentence, the text describes what seems to be an inflammatory process leading up to the appearance of this particular vein. The mention of "inflammation", "blistering" and roots suggests a growth-like phenomenon where the vein is not only visible but also seemingly integrated into the surrounding tissue, much like how plants take root in soil. This could potentially offer insights into the development or growth patterns of veins within the human body.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquella una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquella e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And so many times when something from him goes out because of any cause, wrap that in lead and bind it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the disease is prolonged, then you should make an incision in a part of him and wrap what remains; do not make an incision in that which has already come out, for if you incise it, it will contract and enter the flesh, causing abscesses, decay, and severe ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	It should be treated carefully and extracted gradually from behind him so that nothing remains in his body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, it has been known to come out in some men and extend for five or ten palms, and I have heard of one case where it extended up to twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during the treatment, then insert a tube into the wound and pierce it with a long hollow instrument to reach the body, ensuring that everything within the matter is evacuated, and apply putrefying agents to the location for several days through medications; thereafter treat it with remedies for abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	This vein sometimes has many knots, especially when it appears at the ankle or on the foot; and to him, there came many ulcers, with each ulcer coming out from one knot.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And so treat it in this way as we have said in the division and with what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the incision for worms generated under the skin, it is known as bovine sickness or disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is known as bovine sickness in some regions because the worms resemble maggots found on cattle; it's a type of worm that naturally exists between muscle and flesh, moving throughout the body under the skin, and its movement from limb to limb can be felt until it breaks through the skin.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Their generation occurs due to the putrefaction of certain bodily fluids, just as worms, snakes, and earthworms are born from mud, and roundworms in the stomach.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared for its malicious nature; when it enters the body and rises to the head, reaching the brain, it bursts open there, invading and destroying the brain, which often causes death.

So when you want to treat and extract it, it must be done through its movement and appearance under the skin, then apply firm binding and compression above and below the affected area, followed by drying and extracting the worm.

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	De sectione super aegritudinem nafir." 
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called 'nafir' in our land and it is a pain that appears in some body parts, and then moves from one part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have seen the second case that I will tell you about.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to see a sick woman in a village, and upon examining her arm, I noticed a small inflammation on the veins of her forearm which had been broken for an hour; as I watched it move away from this spot towards that one, more lightly than would be expected, like liquid silver running from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain left that place and settled into her muscles; I stayed here for one hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then it [the pain] passes to another body, entering the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And I observed it return to her whole body, as I had seen before, and was amazed by its changes and the speed with which it moved from part to part.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I had seen this before in my patients according to the same pattern; however, I have observed many cases where pain moves from one body part to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	However, I do not see this in men as much as in women.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I thought it was not because of this but rather due to the woman's old age, as her skin is dry and her veins are visible, and in such cases, one can perceive that wind has been transformed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that this secondary treatment not appear in those who are delicate and have moist skin with prominent veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you wish to treat the patient's pain and they feel discomfort during the procedure, it is not apparent that this smell arises as we have mentioned; instead, press down on them gently yet firmly until the wind is expelled, and then cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	However, if you do not perceive the smell with your own nose, treat it by inducing vomiting and using substances that expel wind from the body, and administer foul-smelling pills and pills made of serpent's flesh or similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On extracting arrows:
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows vary according to the species and the part of the body they strike, for their diversity is such that some have large heads, others small ones, some are concave, others blunt, there are those which are solid, and those with three edges, as well as those with barbs; also there are shafts.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and parts in which the case is according to two ways: for the members are principal members like the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and their likes; therefore when you catch a disease in any of these members and appear signs of death, which cause I will recount soon, then it is fitting that you avoid extraction of that arrow into those where death would be that one who is most disposed to it, and when there appears no such bad sign, and the arrow is not hidden in depth of the member, then take out that arrow and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And the signs of the brain are when you catch an arrow in it, piercing the bone, and issuing from the topmost part which is above the brain, for there happen violent headaches, and blindness, and vertigo, and redness in the eyes, and inflammation and redness of the tongue, and epilepsy and madness of understanding, and vomiting bile, and often one's speech is severely impeded and his voice destroyed; also a white humidity issues from the place of the wound like powder, or wateriness from the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	Therefore if there appear to you these signs, then abstain from cure and extraction of the arrow unless otherwise.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte. E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	Here is the translation of the first sentence:
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount this to you based on what I have observed about these arrows, so that you may understand their significance in the process of healing.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which is caused by an arrowhead becoming lodged in the temple of a man at the base of his nose; I removed it from another part of him and placed a plaster on his ear, he recovered and there was no harm done to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I removed another arrow from a Jew which had pierced him in the eyebrow above his eye, leaving his eyelid closed and shut; the arrow was hidden and could not be reached except for a small end to which its shaft adhered: it was a large Turkish arrowhead with a lion carved into it but no ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	The Jew recovered, and there was no damage to his eye as a result of this injury.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which had struck his throat and was an Arabic arrow with ears/wings; then I incised it between two muscles and the arrow was embedded in his throat; then I carefully handled it and removed it, and the Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	Here is the translation of your provided text:
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And extract the arrow from the man, one of the king's officers, which had fallen into his nose and had slightly deviated to the right, and was completely hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him after the arrow had been embedded for three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then I carefully removed the scabs around the arrowhead and tried to locate it with my delicate touch but could not feel it. However, he felt a pricking sensation below his right ear, so I suspected that this was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	I bandaged the area with an ointment that has attractive and digestive properties, hoping that the wound would become inflamed so I could locate the arrow's position and treat it accordingly.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	There were no significant signs of the arrow reaching any vital areas; I continued to apply the ointment for many days, and still, there was no incident. Meanwhile, the wound had healed over completely, and the patient's condition improved significantly during this time. On one particular day, I felt the arrow inside his nose and immediately realized what had happened.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjusted the opening of the wound by applying acute medicine until the tip of the arrowhead became visible to me, and I allowed some time for it, over four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And since the wound was enlarged, and it became feasible for me to insert the scissors into it, I did so without hesitation. I continued to work on it with various engineering techniques until one day, using specially designed forceps as shown later in this chapter, I successfully extracted the arrowhead; thereafter, I proceeded to treat the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Some physicians believed that the cartilage of the nose could not be regenerated, but I managed to restore it and successfully heal the wound, leading to the patient's full recovery without any complications or discomfort.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	I recommend to you the method of extracting certain types of arrows and provide here some guidelines and notes on this topic that I haven't mentioned, as the variations in procedures and their definitions are not fully covered by my narrative nor does any book comprehensively cover them.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	Skilled artisans should be economical in their speech and compare what is available to them with what they lack, and when faced with a new challenge or an unfamiliar tool, they must investigate the causes behind it.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore, I say that arrows are not expelled from the members in which they are embedded but according to two ways: either by the attraction of the place where it enters; or by the contrary force exerted on another part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And the one that is expelled by the attraction of the place it has entered, or if it is an arrow in fleshy tissue, and is drawn out and cast aside.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey the extraction at the time of being shot, then you must leave it for a few days until the flesh around it putrefies and is loosened from its attraction, facilitating its removal.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if an arrow is embedded in bone and does not yield to your extraction attempt, leave it for a few days and then repeat the process of applying traction and motion every day until it is successfully removed.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it still does not yield to your extraction after a few days, then you must bore into the circumference of the arrow in that bone from all sides with a fine drill until the area is enlarged enough for its removal, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is embedded in the bone of the head and has penetrated into one of the ventricles of the brain, and the patient exhibits some of the symptoms I have mentioned earlier, then refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it be for a few days until its presence is balanced; because if the arrow reaches the medulla, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If it is deeply embedded and does not yield to your extraction, then administer taravels along the course of the arrow as we have recommended, and ensure that you treat the area until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrowhead has penetrated into the chest cavity and is beyond feeling, you must carefully probe for it, and if you find it, then extract it with suitable instruments designed for this purpose.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you are unable to reach it due to the constriction caused by inflammation and because of the length of the arrow shaft, and there is no damage to bones, nerves, or veins, then you should make an incision over the wound so that it can be enlarged sufficiently for the extraction of the arrowhead.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	If they are holding on to their earlobes with the arrowhead embedded in them, you must release the flesh it is lodged in from all sides using every tool at your disposal; and devise a plan for this situation considering that if you cannot achieve the evacuation of the flesh around the fracture of the earlobe or its twisting so as not to cause further damage.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	When you perform the extraction of the arrowhead from any location it may be in, use torsion with your hand like forceps on all sides to make it yield; and do so gently with utmost care so that the arrowhead is not broken during this difficult process of its attraction towards you and subsequent removal.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	Here is the translation of your provided source sentence: 
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if you encounter excessive bleeding, then administer the remedies we have discussed in this chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Be mindful of your skill in making incisions on veins, nerves, or tendons, and take every possible measure to avoid arrowheads becoming lodged within them; carry out this procedure with ease, tranquility, speed, and firmness, just as I have instructed you.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And so you must push the arrowhead in a direction opposite to its entry wound according to the illustration showing the path of the arrow within the patient's body; for this is most beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not feasible for you, then employ the measures that are within your capabilities according to these illustrations.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	In the case of arrows that have bent outwards due to opposition from another part or where you have already extracted some foreign object from one end but now encounter a swelling at the other tip which feels like it has become embedded beneath the bone and sometimes protruding slightly; in such cases, cut into this area with a saw, making an incision as deep as the forceps can reach, then pull out the arrowhead gently.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then you must turn the arm according to its opposite side until the arrowhead presses against the bone, and spread out [the wound?] so that it can be extracted.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it [the arrow] for a few days, then try again until it comes out.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is in there [the wound], then you must push it out with your fingers.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft has fallen out and you want to administer an impulse [push], then insert this concave instrument into it [the wound] so that its cavity fits over the tail of the arrowhead, and push it out with your fingers.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave [the head of the arrow], then push it out with a strong instrument that enters its cavity because the arrow is eased by this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then ensure that you hollow out all the flesh around it, as far as it is possible for you to do so, and then treat the wound with whatever you deem appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow has lodged in the foot, or in the belly, or bladder, or side, and is close enough for you to feel it with a probe, and it is possible for you to cut over this area, then make an incision and take care not to cut any veins or nerves, extract the arrow, then stitch up the wound as needed, and treat the injury until it has healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The way of forceps that are pulled by arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their ends are like the beak of a bird, shaped like a serrated edge to grab onto the arrow and not let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	There are many special types of forceps, large and small, depending on the size of the arrow and its thickness, as well as the breadth of the wound and how deep it is.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of the concave driver at this end is like the claw of a bird to ease the entry of the arrow and provide an impulse for its exit.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of driver at the wound end:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Like a wedge, to facilitate its entry into the concave arrowhead and provide an impulse through it.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On phlebotomy of the veins:
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins that are customarily used for phlebotomy, as mentioned in chapter xvi, are two pulsating veins located just behind the ears, which some call 'alhasisain'; two herbs appearing on both temples; and two veins found beneath the tears of two eyes called 'aspicientz'; there is also a vein prepared at the middle point of the forehead, one situated at the tip of the nose; two cords that are at the neck; two veins underneath the upper lip; two veins underneath the lower lip; these are known as the angelic veins; and finally, two veins that are beneath the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence:
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The recovery of veins near the ears is beneficial for ancient cataracts, migraines, runny noses, and old head ulcers.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	The method of bleeding these veins is as follows: first, shave the patient's head and vigorously rub their head in the occiput area where both veins are located; then have the patient strain their neck with a bandage tied around it so that the two veins appear, just below the ears on either side of the head. You should feel for them with your finger; if you sense any pulsation in these veins using your finger, proceed with the bleeding.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Next, you take the lancet - a cutting instrument - and carefully insert it below the vein so that the phlebotomist can reach the vein with his tool.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	Then, raise your hand with the lancet to the vein and handle both together as you make an incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	The length of the incision should be around two fingers in width, or close to it; let out as much blood as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then apply some powder on the wound, and leave it to heal.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And previously, at the beginning of this book, there was a description of the incision and cauterization of these [ailments].
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	The two veins used in the process of bloodletting, namely the median cephalic vein and the basilic vein, are said to be ancient guardians and powerful healers that remove superfluous and acute excesses from the body.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the manner of performing bloodletting is as I recommend to you: constrict the patient's collar from within until both veins appear visibly and their pulse can be felt beneath your fingers; then, you shall proceed with caution.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then you shall lift the ligature from above the vein towards its upper part with your index finger, introduce the bloodletting instrument underneath it, and lift the vein upwards; incise it in the same manner as you have done with the other two veins; let flow the required quantity of blood.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you shall release the patient from their restraint and place your finger over the vein for an hour; afterwards, apply a compress and bandage it firmly with strong constriction, leaving it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And already the description of them has been preceded, and of those the incision, and the traction at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	Therefore, the use of phlebotomy on the vein in the forehead is now phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for ancient diseases of the face and for migraines, tumors, and foul ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of phlebotomy on him is as I recommend to you: it is that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage until the vein appears; and then take the instrument, which is called a 'fossori', whose shape is like this:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place the pointed end of the fossori on that vein and strike it with a stick or something else in your hand like this, and let the blood flow according to the amount you desire; then untie the patient's wound and bind it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	In some cases, the phlebotomy is done on the side of the neck, but be careful not to use a sharp-pointed phlebotomy instrument as with other phlebotomies, rather it should have a flat edge, and make the phlebotomy in a transverse direction because the bone there is close and strong; a subtle instrument would break inside.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu. Once the phlebotomy is done according to the length of the transverse vein with a few shallow phlebotomies, since there's no flesh in this area; and if your phlebotomy was delicate, its tip won't break easily.

E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	The purpose of bloodletting from these veins is that the patient weakens and becomes light-headed; thus, the practitioner must stand over the patient's head, while the patient sits on a chair.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	However, the bloodletting of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins, should extract the blood from patients suffering from ailments in the throat and neck region, as well as those who have pain in their feet and abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	When performing the bloodletting of this vein, it is imperative that the bloodletter take great care and be mindful of the nearby artery, as a mistake in puncturing with the bloodletting instrument could sever said artery and result in severe bleeding. Thus, one should not perform bloodletting on this area with sharp instruments but rather use scissors or other suitable tools.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear visually, you must leave it be and move on to another one or search for its branch; alternatively, you can perform bloodletting at the end of the arm where that vein is visible as mentioned before, using scissors or other appropriate tools.
