E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see that the ligament is strained and there is swelling in the marked place, then that swelling is an arterial swelling; therefore avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flowing during flebotomy like a child's urine, and it is thin and reddish, then know that it is arterial blood; in such cases, sew it up and place your finger over it for a long time; then remove your finger, and if the blood is still cut off (as many times it will be), then tighten the arm and leave it alone.

E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc. E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And bloodletting from him is difficult in many cases due to the small location of the wound and the possibility of tying his arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	More often, venipuncture for phlebotomy is performed from the veins of the lower part of the arm and the upper part below the chest; because it consists of branches of the basilic and cephalic veins, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa. And this nerve appears to sensation many times; and if it is hidden from some people and is subtle and not visible, then make sure that you place the phlebotomy with the part of the needle that has a smaller diameter, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is located between two nerves, then you must open the vein longitudinally.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The advantage of phlebotomy from the cephalic vein is that you draw blood from the head and apply it to patients with eye diseases.

Certainly! Here is the translation of the text you provided: 
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, in some individuals, the hematoma may be less pronounced when it is not phlebotomized during the first percussion, but we must still note this hematoma.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of this phlebotomy and their symptoms are also matters that require consideration for correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first thing to note is that phlebotomy should only be administered for the preservation of health and as a preventive measure against illness, not as a treatment. Phlebotomy should be performed on one of the veins located in the elbow: cephalic, basilic, or median cubital vein. It is best conducted at the start of spring, before breakfast during spring and autumn, and in winter shortly after eating when signs of fullness appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	Phlebotomy should be conducted on the third day or as soon as three hours have passed since sunrise.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	However, if the need arises due to urgent circumstances or an individual's condition, phlebotomy can be administered at any hour, day or night.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	Children should not undergo phlebotomy until they are 14 years old. Pregnant women should only be phlebotomized between their fourth and seventh months of pregnancy. The elderly, those who have surpassed sixty years of age, should also refrain from undergoing this procedure.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be fleubotomized in any way necessary, it is required that they clean their intestines beforehand with a lion's enema (clisteri leon), especially if there are many retained faeces, so that the veins do not withdraw the superfluities during the phlebotomy of the intestines, which are purified, and that this does not damage the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	Neither should patients suffering from nausea due to intoxication or indigestion be fleubotomized (undergo bloodletting), nor those recovering from illness or debauchery while still weak, nor individuals afflicted with dropsy. Furthermore, phlebotomy ought to be avoided when accompanied by colic pain, vomiting, abdominal conditions, excessive sweating, fatigue, exertion, exercise, fasting, vigil keeping, and any other factor that might cause a loss of strength, whether physical or mental.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	Then consider the elevation of humidity beforehand if their blood is thick; this can be achieved through diet and beverages, as well as medications, should it be feasible for them.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And then enter the bath if no cause prohibits it, or engage in some form of exercise to make the blood more fluid.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And perform the phlebotomy on him at the foot of the bed, around the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And ensure that the patient's foot is protected on that day from all evil accidents caused by animals, such as distress, anger, fear, and also from all bodily accidents like unnecessary toil and pain, costs, and things resembling them.

And let the causes of men's custom to be scented and perfumed, with balms and things similar to them according to possibility, be present at his pillow.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist sit on a cushion that is higher than the one of the patient to be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	Then extend your arm and rub it with your hand two or three times, phlebotomist; and then tighten the ligature with the strap and wrap it around twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	If the ligature is too tight, as when it is not equal [in pressure], or if there is superfluity in the ligature, then it prohibits the flow of blood; but if there is a softening, and thus prohibiting the heart from blood, then...
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And then, when performing the constriction, ensure that the person who is to undergo flebotomy massages their hands together until the veins become inflamed and are palpable.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	Then the phlebotomist should grease their own phlebotomy tool with a small amount of old oil; next, they should place their left index finger on that vein, covering the area where the flebotomy will take place so that the vein fills up slightly and its throbbing stops. If it is one of the veins which run under sinews like chords in strings, you must perform the phlebotomy thereon as well; these are ones full of windiness and when placing your phlebotomy tool over them they contract around it, and so the phlebotomist discovers it hidden; if the vein doesn't open to the flebotomi, then that one is constricted.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	So it's important that the phlebotomist be attentive and mindful of all these matters.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	Then after withdrawing the phlebotomy tool, if blood comes out of the vein in spurts that's good. Otherwise, you should repeat this action elsewhere nearby or slightly above it unless the area is inflamed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And if she loves it, then repeat the bloodletting.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the vein is small and blood flows gently, and you fear that not enough blood will be drawn, then repeat the fleubotomy at this opening with precision and adjust a little bit deeper into the vein. Do this quickly before the site becomes inflamed, for it often happens in many men that only a shallow incision is needed.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that the site is already inflamed, do not repeat the procedure on it, as this will provide you with no additional benefit. Instead, place some olive oil over the area, for it soothes and alleviates the heart of any excess blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And among all oils, olive oil is best for this purpose.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Likewise, apply olive oil to any fleubotomy in which blood must be prohibited from flowing out of the veins due to their prohibition on excess heart blood. And do this with an ointment made of aloeswood and frankincense when placed over one of those areas, as it refines and purifies the blood when it is thick.

And if a large abscess forms at the site of the fleubotomy, which often happens, especially to those who have not been bled for some time or only had a shallow incision made in their vein, then treat it by applying a sponge soaked in warm water and salt, slightly scalded, and hold this over the area for an hour as it will dissolve.

E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And in many instances this occurrence of abscesses and swellings should be treated by bloodletting from the basilica.

And therefore place your hand upon it, and if you then find softness there must be strong pressure applied to this swelling, for such eminence is evil and malignant; and take care that you apply to it some of what has been said before, because blood will flow out from the artery with great force.

The procedure for phlebotomy involves the patient submerging their foot in warm water and applying friction until the veins become visible; then secure the junction of the foot with a strap. The location of the vein is identified as below the big toe, and from there it branches out on the surface of the foot in multiple small branches.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	About cupping and the qualities to look for in those (cups).
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cups are made of horn, metal or glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Cupping is done in two ways: one involves first making a scarification and extracting blood, the other way does not involve any scarification.

Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If need be, proceed with cupping for sickness or continuously; we administer it at the beginning of each hour and toward its end and wherever time permits.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	Which is caused by the fact that in some people the blood becomes thickened due to the extraction of it by cupping and great heaviness ensues; and they find fullness and tightness on their face and head, and on their neck; and they become pale on their face and forehead, dark circles appear under their eyes, and dullness sets in; and those who gush forth blood at the site of cupping; and also those whose laughter increases; and those who have a sweet taste of blood in their mouths or find that their tongues are sore and spit blood; and for those whose sleep becomes excessive, while others see blood in their sleep, great pain and terrors, ulcers and other symptoms similar to theirs.

E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And cupping applied to the two inner parts of the arms results in drawing out blood from three veins through bloodletting; these are the basilic, the cephalic, and the median cubital veins (fusca). That is because it attracts the blood from all those smaller vessels within the flesh, as well as the minute tributaries of other larger veins to ultimately reach those three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	Instruct the cupper to proceed with caution when performing scarification because it is a place that has been stripped of flesh and left bare nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is one cup used to perform cupping over the buttocks, causing hemorrhoids in the anus and similar ulcers below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And now it is necessary to instruct the cupper to apply a strong cupping glass, and that it should be made of horn, as the area requires a deep incision; and with gentle movements, carefully perform the subtle cupping and scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Additionally, apply small cupping glasses to the legs with caution, as they draw blood from the entire body and can aggravate old pains in the joints and hips; it also causes pain in the chest and shoulders; furthermore, it induces menstruation, cures back pain and headaches; serving as a substitute for two-syllable phlebotomy, and so forth, when necessary.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the entire body and may cause syncope in many people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And as for the subsequent cupping, its assistance is similar to that of the cupping on two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the cupping glass position is that you should place the cup at the beginning on a visible area and suck lightly with early suction; do not prolong the placement of the cups, but rather place them gently, and remove them swiftly; allowing the humors to return to their natural state.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease repeating this action and continue until you see the area turn red, swell up, and notice the blood coagulate.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Then you make an incision and continue to extract the blood little by little, while also considering the position of the heart.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For someone with delicate flesh who easily bruises, it is advised to only make one incision and not more, so as to prevent the area from becoming ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the cupper to increase the incision's depth slightly and facilitate the extraction of blood more easily.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	If the blood is thicker in consistency, then it is necessary to make two incisions, as the first incision opens up a path for the thinning of the blood and its aqueous nature.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	The purpose of the second incision is to further scrutinize the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very turbid, then make a third incision to fully attain the desired result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Lastly, when we wish to extract blood gradually or in small amounts, one incision is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a little blood, we make many incisions; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is appropriate to make deep incisions.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	The term 'scarification' simply refers to the depth of the incision.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	If the incision is deep, hard, dark in color, and its edges are narrow, then it is necessary that the places where the cups are applied should be anointed with gentle, open, and resolving oils; if it is summer time, use aloe oil, violet oil, ground almond oil, or egg yolk oil; and if it is winter, use narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, blood serum, and similar substances.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluidity is thick and dense, then use oils like marjoram oil, balm oil, aloe oil, dill oil, and similar ones.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	However, if the person being cupped has wide pores and tender flesh, it is necessary to forbid the use of oil; instead, before applying the cups, their skin should be washed with rosewater or cold water from a spring, egg yolk water, or well water, as well as similar liquids.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	Under someone whose blood is of a very moist nature, wash their abdomen with sour wine or water containing myrtle and sumach or similar things.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	For someone with thick superfluities (likely referring to phlegm or mucus), wash their abdomen with old wine or water infused with sanciuc (majoram), anise, chamomile, and similar herbs.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	Ensure that the washing is done before bathing; make sure it is administered immediately after the bath for one or two hours, and ensure that the patient sleeps with the application still on. 
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What needs to be considered when regulating the washing for someone who has been bled before the washing?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider the following at the beginning: if the washer or the person administering bleeding is choleric and there is sharp and inflamed blood (a sign of heat), then they should take cooling causes, such as vinegar-soaked millet seeds, endive in sour wine and milk, lettuce, rocket, and similar.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And serve them dishes such as boiled meats (poletz), birds for eating, and foods seasoned with acids or sour things, and their likes.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And on the day of venesection and bloodletting, it is advisable for the patient to consume more liquids than food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	It is recommended that some men be given a drink of theriac, or a muscle-strengthening medication, which contains spices like nutmeg, or some light refreshment beforehand during the hours leading up to venesection or bloodletting so that their main limbs are comforted and their blood is made more fluid; they should not take this scalpel.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	The vents that are subject to scarification should be placed on the liver, and above the shoulder and gout, and over the navel, in the areas of the knees, and the hip bone, as these body parts must not undergo any scarification.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	It is not desired for those (vents) to be used merely for the attraction of blood from a body part, like when we place a ventosa on the nipple in diseases where there is an emission of blood through the nostrils; and we make use of it so that the cold humidity of the affected part may be dissolved, as when we place (the cup) on the abdomen and navel; for this rarifies the body part and thaws it, diminishing the pain which resolves the humidity.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is placed on the wounds when they occur in their navel or buttocks, because by virtue of its strong attractive power, this herb draws out the navel and eradicates the boil from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, it acts when applied to the liver and spleen, expelling any excess wind from these organs.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These wind-causing conditions are treated with cupping using suction alone, while some treatments involve the use of fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	Some are treated with cold water applied to the diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the wind-causing condition becomes more severe and widespread; it's either cold water alone or water in which certain suitable herbs have been infused.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	The form of the wind-causing condition treated with fire: let the size of the hole be about two fingers wide, according to how we have shaped it; and let the amount of pressure be half a palm in width; and let it be placed on their side, at the place where the ribs are joined together, being half of them, make the opening small enough for only a needle to fit within.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of flax or citrus, with thick margins, lion's skin, gloves, and towels to prevent the member from harming itself due to its position on him.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And place it in the middle of his thigh with a rod made of wood or iron, upon which a candle is placed and lit.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this bellows should be much larger than the one we previously described, and smaller for those who need less air depending on their illnesses or age.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the bellows for infants and exhausted people must be different from those used by young people or those with robust physiques.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The way to place this bellows with fire on the member is by extending the flame of decent firewood in front of a small wax candle, and placing it over the middle of the transverse rod at the center of the bellows so that the fire is lit around the area beneath without burning the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Once it has been placed on the patient's member as we described before, with your finger over the hole that we mentioned earlier, when you have the bellows and do not need to move your finger because the steam is coming out of said hole, then the bellows will slowly start to deflate.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then apply the medication according to its manner, and repeat if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	In May, apply a cupping glass to the patient with pleurisy; fill it only with water, ensuring there is no cross mark or crack, and place it on the affected area.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	This is the shape of it: The larger the cupping glass, the better, as it can accommodate a greater amount of water.

Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not applied to many body parts but only to those areas where cupping glasses cannot be placed due to their small size, such as the palm and gums, or on fleshless members like fingers and noses.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	The quality of the leeches you use is important; ensure they are found in clean, stagnant waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Leave them in stagnant water both day and night until they are well-fed, ensuring there is no food left in their bellies; then evacuate the patient's body through bloodletting (flebotomia) and cupping glasses; rub the affected area of the patient until it reddens; finally, apply the leeches.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled and closed.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck the place with a ventouse (sucking instrument), it is even more beneficial.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with vinegar and then with warm water; let it be rubbed and wrung out.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body's blood is let out through the application of leeches, and this is repeated, then you place a cloth wrung out in cold water, and put it on until the discharge has stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is excessive, then sprinkle over it powdered vitriol (sulfate of zinc), or substances similar to astringent medicines until the blood stops flowing; or put on the area bean poultices that have been well-cooked and leave them there until the beans adhere to the place where the bleeding has stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And now, if it is necessary, repeat the application of leeches, when you can change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are forbidden to be used, then rub the place with fresh blood or stick a needle in certain places until blood comes out and put them on as soon as they feel some blood coming.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to urinate, sprinkle a little powdered aloe, salt, or ash over it and they will urinate soon.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Just as the third part of the treatise begins, it is about restoration [of health].
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very useful and necessary in the art of medicine, and it deals with the restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, my child, be aware that this chapter is scoffed at by foolish doctors and laypeople, as well as those who have never studied the works of the Ancients or read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, the scientific method has been neglected in our land; and I have not forgotten it at any time, but have added to it by carefully reading the works of the Ancients and studying their wisdom thoroughly.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	Then, I dedicated my life to experimentation and study.

E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their previous diet with which they are accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And as the broken bone begins to heal, it is necessary that the patient be fed with nourishing foods of high fat and protein content, such as wheat porridge cooked with water, rice, cheese, fish, beef bellies, eggs, fresh meat, and similar items. With this diet, the fracture will coagulate more easily and quickly.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	Know that broken bones in men who are either very young or elderly will not heal and consolidate properly due to the dryness of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and continue to heal according to their nature despite the dryness of those limbs, just as bones in young children do.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature provides a mechanism for adjusting and knitting together the broken bone by means of some substance similar to glue, which is its own thickness that binds it within itself as it becomes consolidated and tied up, until it achieves full strength and firmness, just like fire at the beginning does not prevent anything from performing its functions.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And due to this reason, it is necessary that you remove the food from the patient's diet; foods that are heavy and greasy as well as coarse in nature, just as we have stated before.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a different variety of fractures depending on the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures vary according to the different limbs; a fracture in the bone of the leg is different from a fracture in the skull, and similarly, a fracture in the foot bone differs from a fracture in the spine, and likewise for all other body parts.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I want a detailed recollection of every type of fracture, explained in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is also a different variety of fractures within the same limb or body part.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	The types of fractures vary even within the same bone; some are curved or stellate in nature while others occur along the length of the bone: there are greenstick and complete fractures as well as comminuted ones, with or without displacement, just like how a pen is prepared to write, and there's also depression and disruption of the skull, and hairline fractures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And in every detail it is necessary that there be an engine or instrument proper for restoration, as will come the recollection of them separately in their places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Signs of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And a bone fracture is known by these signs: the twisting of it, and that prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and also when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And thus, when there is no apparent twist in its place nor was it done with your touch when you feel the bone with movement and the patient does not find great pain, then here there is no fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	Later, it is possible that there may be a twist or small fissure, in which case you should not feel it with your hand and by compressing it entirely; rather, place on it one of the medicines for which you will recall at that moment which are appropriate for the location; and then let it rest under close observation.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that for the place which is arched and not divided into two or another thing which does not happen in it externally, like when swelling has occurred on every part of its comparison, then you must begin from this hour to rectify it before it happens that a painful boil appears.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration and recovery of the patient is lighter [quicker] than when a bone fracture occurs.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Then strengthen that second person who will recall the patient's memory.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is indeed fractured, it is necessary to extend that broken limb by two parts, whether it's the hand or foot; use your own hand if the limb is small; or use two ropes, or one rope and a hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be such that you place the limb in its natural alignment, while the separated parts of the broken limb are extended; now you must ensure that you make those pieces return to their original places with mechanism and according to any way you can manage.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And make sure, according to your strength, that you do not inflict further pain or injury upon the patient by your operation; and ensure, as much as it is in your power, that you apply one bone to its other companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And know that in that opportune hour you must touch [move] it with your hand; and if at any point you see some other cause for concern, correct this and align it by the amount of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Certainly! Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then connect the appropriate equation and decent operation to the structure of that member, providing rest and tranquility. Instruct the patient about this and ensure they avoid harming that area while awake or asleep; observe their reactions, excretion, and all movements with your whole strength. Wait until you find a position for the limb where there is no pain, as it is known that when feeling pain or injury in one limb's position, it must be changed to another without such pain. Take care that the patient maintains this correct and equal position so that the member does not become twisted once restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the member's structure break is what I recommend to you; for the members that are broken differ in their smallness and greatness, as well as in their form.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small like the arm, finger and penis, then it is necessary that the wrapping be of a very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large like the thigh or leg, it is necessary to wrap them tightly and hard because a tight bandage joins the big and strong member with equality of pressure on all sides so as not to let any stain enter.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to that part of the wound which is most painful or sensitive when touched, and hold your hand gently but firmly so as not to aggravate the broken area.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then extend your hand around the fracture site gently, loosening the constriction gradually as you remove it.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Now take another bandage and wrap it around the fracture site once more, starting below where you first placed your hand; perform this operation with the same care as before.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	Then place between the bandages a splint or cloth that follows the curvature of the fracture if there is one; otherwise, leave nothing in it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	Now place another bandage over it and secure these wrappings with the appropriate number of splints, unless there is a swelling or infection at this site, in which case you must first remove what causes it before proceeding; let them remain for several days, then hold fast your hand upon them.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	If the splints are of half-inch cane and well formed; or of poplar wood; or palm ribs, they should be as wide as this shape and form suggests:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	Fine threads are not suitable because you will not be able to achieve tightness with them, and it is necessary that there should be less than a finger's width between the needles.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is tied at the ends of their limbs near the tightened areas, place some strips of lion skin or padded wool underneath so that it does not harm them.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some fractures are due to injury, and there is a disruption in the sequence of events. I will come back to this in more detail in Chapter 2.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	Be aware that not every broken limb can be straightened with traction on the first day; this is because when the limb is large, it should not be loaded with weights but rather after a few days or more, depending on your certainty of avoiding the risk of abscess formation.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is how the ancient physicians made plasters, which they placed on fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	The method of plaster as a quick fix for fracture repair is appropriate for complex cases and especially for women and children because it does not produce heat or chafing: take some fine powder, which is the flour that sticks to the mill's walls due to the movement of the millstone.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And confirm that it is so by using an egg test, and let the concoction not be thick nor subtle, then use it accordingly.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to make a restorative plaster for fractures, dislocations, and sprains: Take assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula (elecampane), and migrach, which is the root of wild mustard; of each, take 10 drams. Take 5 drams of myrrh and aloe, and 20 drams of alochil (a type of plant); all should be finely ground and sifted. Mix them with garlic water or egg white if the patient's wound is open; then apply this plaster, for it has a good composition and can restore lightly broken bones, and many men have attested to its effectiveness.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for a plaster that heals fractures and sprains: Take migrach (wild mustard root) and half as much white elm, 5 drams each of myrrh and aloe, 6 drams of acacia, and 2 drams of Armenian bole.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All ingredients should be ground in a mortar with a pestle, then sifted and mixed with water or egg white before being administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	In this plaster, there is no restorative substance; it aims to cure abscesses and expel pain.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another way of making a plaster that restores blocked passages: take fresh leaves from the fig tree and wild poppy leaves, mix them together, and make a plaster out of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A simplified method of plaster for treating bone fractures and promoting the resolution of abscess residue: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile flowers, and violet blossoms, combine with bran flour, grind them all together finely; mix with wine if the limb is not wounded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if the limb is wounded, then apply the mixture with moist coriander water or plain water only.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another way of applying a very strong plaster for treating hard abscesses that require limb restoration: take marshmallow roots, flax seeds, balsam leaves, mallow herb, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile blossoms; grind everything together finely and mix with willow water or fresh water or wine - whichever is most suitable according to the quality of the limb and its colour.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	In Wales, it has been seen that they place wax on the broken limb for its restoration and to treat the causes where there is excessive dryness due to lack of warmth; these are similar to myrrh, incense, and other substances like those we have mentioned before.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method for making a plaster to treat injuries and pain: Take powdered eggshells, human hair cuttings or bird feathers, marshmallow root, and salt, all in equal parts; grind, sift, and mix them together to form a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The duration for which the bandage should remain in place depends on whether there is pain, swelling, or if the bone is broken; if none of these symptoms are present and the injury is not severe, you can leave it bound for multiple days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is sudden pain, swelling, or inflammation at the site of the injury, then you should quickly remove and loosen the bandage, taking off the plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a piece of cloth and a moist sea sponge, dip it in warm water, and use this to gently wash the affected area until the swelling and pain subside; then let the limb rest for an hour. Afterward, place soft wool soaked in vinegar or rose oil over it and bandage securely, leaving it on overnight to ensure any abscess is healed, the swelling has reduced, and the patient's pain is relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that subtle compression and apply a small plaster, do not strain the initial pressure, be subtle with what you have within to heal.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess, scab, pain, inflammation, and all other symptoms have completely improved, and you need to use a plaster and compression again, then repeat the same process as you did initially.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there is no injury to the limb caused by any of the aforementioned factors, then do not remove the plaster for three, four, five or seven days; in some cases, it can be left for up to twenty days depending on how long it takes for the limb to heal as mentioned before, until the fracture heals and the flesh coagulates over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the compression tighter than the initial one, according to the patient's memory of their injury.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	However, if you see that the fracture site is already dried and shriveled more than it should be, know that nutrition is prohibited from reaching it; therefore, you must wet it with tepid water every time you remove the plaster; do this for three days in a row; loosen the compression slightly, and through this operation, blood will run to the limb again, healing it little by little.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone among them do this, so it is more reasonable that it should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On fractures of the skull (or head).
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their forms are diverse, with distinct causes. Some fractures occur due to the impact of space (or force), driving all the bones into the skull, similar to how it happens in wood; this type is called "ascia." Or, a fracture may occur when an object penetrates part of the bone but does not pierce through, only affecting its outer layer and flesh without reaching the brain. This latter kind is known as "levatio absoluta.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The severity of these two fracture types can vary greatly, and there is another kind of fracture known as "contrusio" or "contusi," caused by blunt force trauma from an object like a club or a fall onto rocks, which resembles the former two in its appearance.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	This fracture can be either penetrating, nearly reaching the membrane beneath the bone, or it can affect only the surface of the bone, and in both cases, their severity can range from minor to severe.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this is mostly done in bodies with moist bones, like babies.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	So for all these types of fractures, they are treated with splints like wooden stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come to review everything in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I know all these types of fractures by their detection, examination with touch, and the removal of corrupted flesh on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	The fracture of the small bone is known when it is exposed on the skin, cleaned, and bound with bandages because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	When starting the treatment of fractures, you must first consider the patient's symptoms, and if you notice any signs of severity by evident manifestation such as vomiting bile, fainting, loss of reason, loss of voice, collapse, acute fever, urination without wanting to, retention of urine, and similar symptoms in more serious cases, then one should not proceed with treatment.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see the absence of these symptoms, then hope for recovery and begin treating him.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has reached the brain's covering layer (meninges) and is also divided into small pieces with an irregular shape, you should incise this affected part as I will explain to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	If you shave the patient's head affected by this disease and uncover the bone following your custom and manner according to the shape of the lesion, and if it is light when felt on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you accidentally detect bone, blood discharge or abscess formation, you should oppose the patient's movement and apply to the area cloths infused in wine and rose oil, allowing the lesion to rest until the abscess subsides, being confident of the absence of further bleeding; then begin with the osseous circumference circumcision and its excision.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	This is according to one of two methods for the surgical intervention.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	One of them consists of incising the bone with a straight saw like this one, and this is its shape:" (please provide me with an image reference so I can describe it) "Then use another saw like this slightly wider than that; and this is its shape:" (the same as before)

E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them [the servants] to facilitate percussion on the incision so that you do not hit and damage his head.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	If the bone is strong and hard, then you should make a hole in its circumference before you use the scissors [incisions] with the tools that are called non-penetrating taravels.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called that [non-penetrating taravels] but rather this, as these do not reach the limit of the bone's thickness, because at the taravel there is a round end or edge on which rests the head of the auger resembling an edge or small circle, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the bone's thickness.

It is advisable that you take many of these taravels, each suitable for the thickness of each bone, while ensuring that all brains have their ends sharpened and that the quantity in length and shortness corresponds to the degree of thickness of this brain.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three types of taravels: The quality to drill into the circumference of the broken bone is that you place the taravel on the bone and turn it with your fingers, provided that you know that the bone has been penetrated; then change the taravel to another place, and put what is between all through the amount of thickness of a finger or thereabouts.

And it is necessary that you make these powdered medicines and sprinkle them over the wound, especially when they are dry; universally, administer all medicine with properties that cleanse and do not bite.

E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the incision is small or you are concerned about infection, fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the size of the gap in the skin.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an infection occurs, soak a cloth in vinegar and rose oil mixed with wine, then place it over the affected area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But if the tightness around the bone where the incision and section are made, you should apply a plaster made from flour with egg whites, place it over a lion's fat, then place a needle under it, if required, and take some earthworm juice, which is what the Saracens have, making sure it is long enough to be around one palm or thereabouts; then put double powder on top of the fat and plaster; after that, take a thin board whose width is three fingers wide and similar in length; wrap the board with cloth, then wrap the cloth and board over the place where the fracture is located; next, apply some more earthworm juice as it dries, turning it around the patient's neck from behind them to where they are injured, reducing it down across all parts until you have tightened up the plaster on the broken bone, which should not be hidden by any other part of your body.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not untie the binding unless there is an abscess or inflammation in the exact spot within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	Then renew the plaster if you notice the appearance of pus or inflammation, adjust it to fit tightly, and restore it; leave it in place until both the wound is healed and the fracture of the fork-bone has solidified.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And have it bound tightly and provided with support according to the month within twenty-eight days, although in some men, this can be achieved in less time.
